definition: philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
yes
-ism/only/alone
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
objective idealism (in Hegel's philosophy)
pinyin: ke4 guan1 wei2 xin1 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Kant and Hegel have developed idealism.
sentences.chinese: 康德和黑格尔发展了唯心主义。

sentences.english: A idealism game, only you see it is it exist.
sentences.chinese: 一个唯心主义的游戏，只有你看到的才是存在的。

sentences.english: There are two kinds of comprehensions—idealism and contemplative materialism—in the history.
sentences.chinese: 历史上出现了唯心主义和直观唯物主义两种理解方式。

sentences.english: Magee: Obviously that means not only that you reject idealism but also that you reject dualism.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，你反对唯心主义，而且也反对二元论。

sentences.english: I never appreciated idealism before. Yet I can't accept it.
sentences.chinese: 以前我从没有欣赏过唯心主义，尽管我仍然接受不了。

sentences.english: This is a heated debate which involves materialist as opposed to idealist views.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场唯物主义与唯心主义的大论战。

sentences.english: In the following discussion, only physicalistic monisms are considered. (See also: idealism.
sentences.chinese: 这样的唯心主义的一元论现在在西方不很常见。

sentences.english: Recognition of Philosophical Idealism from Logical Priority;
sentences.chinese: 我思故我在〔唯心主义哲学的一种说法〕。

sentences.english: In his eyes, all of these kinds of new Marxism are a kind of human-centralization as idealism.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来这些都是唯心主义的人类中心主义。

materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
materialistic
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality

definition: metaphysics
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
atheism
historical materialism (Marx's theory of history)
pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: dialectics/dialectic or Socratic method of debate
nihilism
voluntarism/metaphysical view, esp. due to Schopenhauer 叔本華|叔本华[Shu1 ben3 hua2], that the essence of the world is willpower
